intro: Chilita jaliscana, commonly known as the Jalisco chilita, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces delicate, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
